trans-unit.source: Configuring a custom domain name for an Azure website
trans-unit.target: Configuring a custom domain name for an Azure website

trans-unit.source: When you create a website, Azure provides a friendly subdomain on the azurewebsites.net domain so your users can access your website using a URL like http://<mysite>.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: When you create a website, Azure provides a friendly subdomain on the azurewebsites.net domain so your users can access your website using a URL like http://<mysite>.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: However, if you configure your websites for Shared or Standard mode, you can map your website to your own domain name.
trans-unit.target: However, if you configure your websites for Shared or Standard mode, you can map your website to your own domain name.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can use Azure Traffic Manager to load balance incoming traffic to your website.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can use Azure Traffic Manager to load balance incoming traffic to your website.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how Traffic Manager works with Websites, see <link><linkText>Controlling Azure Web Sites Traffic with Azure Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how Traffic Manager works with Websites, see <link><linkText>Controlling Azure Web Sites Traffic with Azure Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The procedures in this task apply to Azure Websites; for Cloud Services, see <html></html>Configuring a Custom Domain Name in Azure<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: The procedures in this task apply to Azure Websites; for Cloud Services, see <html></html>Configuring a Custom Domain Name in Azure<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this task require you to configure your websites for Shared or Standard mode, which may change how much you are billed for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this task require you to configure your websites for Shared or Standard mode, which may change how much you are billed for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <html></html>Websites Pricing Details<html></html> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <html></html>Websites Pricing Details<html></html> for more information.

trans-unit.source: In this article:
trans-unit.target: In this article:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Understanding CNAME and A records</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Understanding CNAME and A records</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure your web sites for shared or standard mode</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure your web sites for shared or standard mode</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Add your web sites to Traffic Manager</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add your web sites to Traffic Manager</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Add a CNAME for your custom domain</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add a CNAME for your custom domain</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Add an A record for your custom domain</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Add an A record for your custom domain</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Understand CNAME and A records
trans-unit.target: Understand CNAME and A records

trans-unit.source: CNAME (or alias records) and A records both allow you to associate a domain name with a website, however they each work differently.
trans-unit.target: CNAME (or alias records) and A records both allow you to associate a domain name with a website, however they each work differently.

trans-unit.source: CNAME or Alias record
trans-unit.target: CNAME or Alias record

trans-unit.source: A CNAME record maps a specific domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, to a canonical domain name.
trans-unit.target: A CNAME record maps a specific domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, to a canonical domain name.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the canonical domain name is the either the .azurewebsites.net domain name of your Azure website or the .trafficmgr.com domain name of your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the canonical domain name is the either the .azurewebsites.net domain name of your Azure website or the .trafficmgr.com domain name of your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the .azurewebsites.net or .trafficmgr.com domain name.
trans-unit.target: Once created, the CNAME creates an alias for the .azurewebsites.net or .trafficmgr.com domain name.

trans-unit.source: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your .azurewebsites.net or .trafficmgr.com domain name automatically, so if the IP address of the website changes, you do not have to take any action.
trans-unit.target: The CNAME entry will resolve to the IP address of your .azurewebsites.net or .trafficmgr.com domain name automatically, so if the IP address of the website changes, you do not have to take any action.

trans-unit.source: Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as www.contoso.com, and not root names, such as contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: Some domain registrars only allow you to map subdomains when using a CNAME record, such as www.contoso.com, and not root names, such as contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, <html></html>the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record<html></html>, or the <html></html>IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification<html></html> document.
trans-unit.target: For more information on CNAME records, see the documentation provided by your registrar, <html></html>the Wikipedia entry on CNAME record<html></html>, or the <html></html>IETF Domain Names - Implementation and Specification<html></html> document.

trans-unit.source: A record
trans-unit.target: A record

trans-unit.source: An A record maps a domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, or a wildcard domain such as \*.contoso.com, to an IP address.
trans-unit.target: An A record maps a domain, such as contoso.com or www.contoso.com, or a wildcard domain such as \*.contoso.com, to an IP address.

trans-unit.source: In the case of an Azure Website, either the virtual IP of the service or a specific IP address that you purchased for your website.
trans-unit.target: In the case of an Azure Website, either the virtual IP of the service or a specific IP address that you purchased for your website.

trans-unit.source: So the main benefit of an A record over a CNAME record is that you can have one entry that uses a wildcard, such as *.contoso.com, which would handle requests for multiple sub-domains such as mail.contoso.com, login.contoso.com, or www.contso.com.
trans-unit.target: So the main benefit of an A record over a CNAME record is that you can have one entry that uses a wildcard, such as *.contoso.com, which would handle requests for multiple sub-domains such as mail.contoso.com, login.contoso.com, or www.contso.com.

trans-unit.source: Since an A record is mapped to a static IP address, it cannot automatically resolve changes to the IP address of your website.
trans-unit.target: Since an A record is mapped to a static IP address, it cannot automatically resolve changes to the IP address of your website.

trans-unit.source: An IP address for use with A records is provided when you configure custom domain name settings for your website; however, this value may change if you delete and recreate your website, or change the website mode to back to free.
trans-unit.target: An IP address for use with A records is provided when you configure custom domain name settings for your website; however, this value may change if you delete and recreate your website, or change the website mode to back to free.

trans-unit.source: A records cannot be used for load balancing with Traffic Manager.
trans-unit.target: A records cannot be used for load balancing with Traffic Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Controlling Azure Web Sites Traffic with Azure Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Controlling Azure Web Sites Traffic with Azure Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Configure your websites for shared or standard mode<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Configure your websites for shared or standard mode<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Setting a custom domain name on a website is only available for the Shared and Standard modes for Azure websites.
trans-unit.target: Setting a custom domain name on a website is only available for the Shared and Standard modes for Azure websites.

trans-unit.source: Before switching a website from the Free website mode to the Shared or Standard website mode, you must first remove spending caps in place for your Website subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before switching a website from the Free website mode to the Shared or Standard website mode, you must first remove spending caps in place for your Website subscription.

trans-unit.source: For more information on Shared and Standard mode pricing, see <link><linkText>Pricing Details[pricingdetails]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Shared and Standard mode pricing, see <link><linkText>Pricing Details[pricingdetails]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site.
trans-unit.target: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site.

trans-unit.source: Click the SCALE tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SCALE tab.

trans-unit.source: In the general section, set the website mode by clicking SHARED.
trans-unit.target: In the general section, set the website mode by clicking SHARED.

trans-unit.source: If you will be using Traffic Manager with this website, you must use select Standard mode instead of Shared.
trans-unit.target: If you will be using Traffic Manager with this website, you must use select Standard mode instead of Shared.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: When prompted about the increase in cost for Shared mode (or for Standard mode if you choose Standard), click Yes if you agree.
trans-unit.target: When prompted about the increase in cost for Shared mode (or for Standard mode if you choose Standard), click Yes if you agree.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: If you receive a "Configuring scale for website 'website name' failed" error, you can use the details button to get more information.
trans-unit.target: If you receive a "Configuring scale for website 'website name' failed" error, you can use the details button to get more information.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html>(Optional) Add your websites to Traffic Manager<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html>(Optional) Add your websites to Traffic Manager<html></html>

trans-unit.source: If you want to use your website with Traffic Manager, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use your website with Traffic Manager, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have a Traffic Manager profile, use the information in <link><linkText>Create a Traffic Manager profile using Quick Create[createprofile]</linkText><title></title></link> to create one.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have a Traffic Manager profile, use the information in <link><linkText>Create a Traffic Manager profile using Quick Create[createprofile]</linkText><title></title></link> to create one.

trans-unit.source: Note the .trafficmgr.com domain name associated with your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: Note the .trafficmgr.com domain name associated with your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: This will be used in a later step.
trans-unit.target: This will be used in a later step.

trans-unit.source: Use the information in <link><linkText>Add or Delete Endpoints[addendpoint]</linkText><title></title></link> to add your website as an endpoint in your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in <link><linkText>Add or Delete Endpoints[addendpoint]</linkText><title></title></link> to add your website as an endpoint in your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: If your website is not listed when adding an endpoint, verify that it is configured for Standard mode.
trans-unit.target: If your website is not listed when adding an endpoint, verify that it is configured for Standard mode.

trans-unit.source: You must use Standard mode for your website in order to work with Traffic Manager.
trans-unit.target: You must use Standard mode for your website in order to work with Traffic Manager.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME records.
trans-unit.target: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME records.

trans-unit.source: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.
trans-unit.target: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.

trans-unit.source: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.
trans-unit.target: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.

trans-unit.source: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME.
trans-unit.target: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME.

trans-unit.source: For example, www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: You must also provide a host name that is the canonical domain name for this CNAME alias.
trans-unit.target: You must also provide a host name that is the canonical domain name for this CNAME alias.

trans-unit.source: This is the .trafficmgr.com name for your website.
trans-unit.target: This is the .trafficmgr.com name for your website.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.trafficmgr.com, the domain name of a website:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.trafficmgr.com, the domain name of a website:

trans-unit.source: Alias/Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Alias/Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: Canonical domain
trans-unit.target: Canonical domain

trans-unit.source: www
trans-unit.target: www

trans-unit.source: contoso.trafficmgr.com
trans-unit.target: contoso.trafficmgr.com

trans-unit.source: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host
trans-unit.target: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host

trans-unit.source: (contoso.azurewebsite.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the end user.
trans-unit.target: (contoso.azurewebsite.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the end user.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Traffic Manager with a website, you do not need to follow the steps in the following sections, 'Add a CNAME for your custom domain' and 'Add an A record for your custom domain'.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Traffic Manager with a website, you do not need to follow the steps in the following sections, 'Add a CNAME for your custom domain' and 'Add an A record for your custom domain'.

trans-unit.source: The CNAME record created in the previous steps will route incoming traffic to Traffic Manager, which then routes the traffic to the website endpoint(s).
trans-unit.target: The CNAME record created in the previous steps will route incoming traffic to Traffic Manager, which then routes the traffic to the website endpoint(s).

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Add a CNAME for your custom domain<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Add a CNAME for your custom domain<html></html>

trans-unit.source: To create a CNAME record, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by your registrar.
trans-unit.target: To create a CNAME record, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by your registrar.

trans-unit.source: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying a CNAME record, but the concepts are the same.
trans-unit.target: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying a CNAME record, but the concepts are the same.

trans-unit.source: Use one of these methods to find the .azurewebsite.net domain name assigned to your website.
trans-unit.target: Use one of these methods to find the .azurewebsite.net domain name assigned to your website.

trans-unit.source: Login to the Azure Management Portal[portal], select your website, select Dashboard, and then find the Site URL entry in the quick glance section.
trans-unit.target: Login to the Azure Management Portal[portal], select your website, select Dashboard, and then find the Site URL entry in the quick glance section.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure <link><linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure Command Line Interface</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure Command Line Interface</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Save this .azurewebsite.net name, as it will be used in the following steps.
trans-unit.target: Save this .azurewebsite.net name, as it will be used in the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME records.
trans-unit.target: Now find where you can select or enter CNAME records.

trans-unit.source: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.
trans-unit.target: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.

trans-unit.source: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.
trans-unit.target: You should look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.

trans-unit.source: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME.
trans-unit.target: You must also provide the domain or subdomain alias for the CNAME.

trans-unit.source: For example, www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create an alias for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create an alias for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.

trans-unit.source: You must also provide a host name that is the canonical domain name for this CNAME alias.
trans-unit.target: You must also provide a host name that is the canonical domain name for this CNAME alias.

trans-unit.source: This is the .azurewebsite.net name for your website.
trans-unit.target: This is the .azurewebsite.net name for your website.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.azurewebsite.net, the domain name of a website:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following CNAME record forwards all traffic from www.contoso.com to contoso.azurewebsite.net, the domain name of a website:

trans-unit.source: Alias/Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Alias/Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: Canonical domain
trans-unit.target: Canonical domain

trans-unit.source: www
trans-unit.target: www

trans-unit.source: contoso.azurewebsite.net
trans-unit.target: contoso.azurewebsite.net

trans-unit.source: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host
trans-unit.target: A visitor of www.contoso.com will never see the true host

trans-unit.source: (contoso.azurewebsite.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the
trans-unit.target: (contoso.azurewebsite.net), so the forwarding process is invisible to the

trans-unit.source: end user.
trans-unit.target: end user.

trans-unit.source: The example above only applies to traffic at the www subdomain.
trans-unit.target: The example above only applies to traffic at the www subdomain.

trans-unit.source: Since you cannot use wildcards with CNAME records, you must create one CNAME for each domain/subdomain.
trans-unit.target: Since you cannot use wildcards with CNAME records, you must create one CNAME for each domain/subdomain.

trans-unit.source: If you want to direct traffic from subdomains, such as *.contoso.com, to your azurewebsite.net address, you can configure a URL Redirect or URL Forward entry in your DNS settings, or create an A record.
trans-unit.target: If you want to direct traffic from subdomains, such as *.contoso.com, to your azurewebsite.net address, you can configure a URL Redirect or URL Forward entry in your DNS settings, or create an A record.

trans-unit.source: It can take some time for your CNAME to propagate through the DNS system.
trans-unit.target: It can take some time for your CNAME to propagate through the DNS system.

trans-unit.source: You cannot set the CNAME for the website until the CNAME has propagated.
trans-unit.target: You cannot set the CNAME for the website until the CNAME has propagated.

trans-unit.source: You can use a service such as <html></html>http://www.digwebinterface.com/<html></html> to verify that the CNAME is available.
trans-unit.target: You can use a service such as <html></html>http://www.digwebinterface.com/<html></html> to verify that the CNAME is available.

trans-unit.source: Add the domain name to your website
trans-unit.target: Add the domain name to your website

trans-unit.source: After the CNAME record for domain name has propagated, you must associate it with your website.
trans-unit.target: After the CNAME record for domain name has propagated, you must associate it with your website.

trans-unit.source: You can add the custom domain name defined by the CNAME record to your website by using either the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI) or by using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can add the custom domain name defined by the CNAME record to your website by using either the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI) or by using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To add a domain name using the command-line tools
trans-unit.target: To add a domain name using the command-line tools

trans-unit.source: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure Command-Line Interface</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure Command-Line Interface</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: For example, the following will add a custom domain name of www.contoso.com to the contoso.azurewebsite.net website:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following will add a custom domain name of www.contoso.com to the contoso.azurewebsite.net website:

trans-unit.source: You can confirm that the custom domain name was added to the website by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: You can confirm that the custom domain name was added to the website by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: The list returned by this command should contain the custom domain name, as well as the default .azurewebsite.net entry.
trans-unit.target: The list returned by this command should contain the custom domain name, as well as the default .azurewebsite.net entry.

trans-unit.source: To add a domain name using the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To add a domain name using the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the DOMAIN NAMES text box, type the domain name that you have configured.
trans-unit.target: In the DOMAIN NAMES text box, type the domain name that you have configured.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to accept the domain name.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to accept the domain name.

trans-unit.source: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the domain names section of the Configure page of your website.
trans-unit.target: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the domain names section of the Configure page of your website.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Add an A Record for your custom domain<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html>Add an A Record for your custom domain<html></html>

trans-unit.source: To create an A record, you must first find the IP address of your website.
trans-unit.target: To create an A record, you must first find the IP address of your website.

trans-unit.source: Then add an entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.
trans-unit.target: Then add an entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using the tools provided by your registrar.

trans-unit.source: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying an A record, but the concepts are the same.
trans-unit.target: Each registrar has a similar but slightly different method of specifying an A record, but the concepts are the same.

trans-unit.source: In addition to creating an A record, you must also create a CNAME record that Azure uses to verify the A record.
trans-unit.target: In addition to creating an A record, you must also create a CNAME record that Azure uses to verify the A record.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: On the Manage custom domains dialog, locate The IP Address to use when configuring A records.
trans-unit.target: On the Manage custom domains dialog, locate The IP Address to use when configuring A records.

trans-unit.source: Copy the IP address.
trans-unit.target: Copy the IP address.

trans-unit.source: This will be used when creating the A record.
trans-unit.target: This will be used when creating the A record.

trans-unit.source: On the Manage custom domains dialog, note awverify domain name at the end of the text at the top of the dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Manage custom domains dialog, note awverify domain name at the end of the text at the top of the dialog.

trans-unit.source: It should be awverify.mysite.azurewebsites.net where mysite is the name of your website.
trans-unit.target: It should be awverify.mysite.azurewebsites.net where mysite is the name of your website.

trans-unit.source: Copy this, as it is the domain name used when creating the verification CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: Copy this, as it is the domain name used when creating the verification CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your DNS registrar's website, and go to the page for managing DNS.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Find where you can select or enter A and CNAME records.
trans-unit.target: Find where you can select or enter A and CNAME records.

trans-unit.source: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.
trans-unit.target: You may have to select the record type from a drop down, or go to an advanced settings page.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to create the A record:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create the A record:

trans-unit.source: Select or enter the domain or subdomain that will use the A record.
trans-unit.target: Select or enter the domain or subdomain that will use the A record.

trans-unit.source: For example, select www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, select www if you want to create an alias for www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a wildcard entry for all subdomains, enter '*'.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a wildcard entry for all subdomains, enter '*'.

trans-unit.source: This will cover all sub-domains such as mail.customdomain.com, login.customdomain.com, and www.customdomain.com.
trans-unit.target: This will cover all sub-domains such as mail.customdomain.com, login.customdomain.com, and www.customdomain.com.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create an A record for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create an A record for the root domain, it may be listed as the '@' symbol in your registrar's DNS tools.

trans-unit.source: Enter the IP address of your cloud service in the provided field.
trans-unit.target: Enter the IP address of your cloud service in the provided field.

trans-unit.source: This associates the domain entry used in the A record with the IP address of your cloud service deployment.
trans-unit.target: This associates the domain entry used in the A record with the IP address of your cloud service deployment.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following A record forwards all traffic from contoso.com to 137.135.70.239, the IP address of our deployed application:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following A record forwards all traffic from contoso.com to 137.135.70.239, the IP address of our deployed application:

trans-unit.source: Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: IP address
trans-unit.target: IP address

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates creating an A record for the root domain.
trans-unit.target: This example demonstrates creating an A record for the root domain.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to create a wildcard entry to cover all subdomains, you would enter '*' as the subdomain.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to create a wildcard entry to cover all subdomains, you would enter '*' as the subdomain.

trans-unit.source: Next, create a CNAME record that has an alias of awverify, and a canonical domain of awverify.mysite.azurewebsites.net that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Next, create a CNAME record that has an alias of awverify, and a canonical domain of awverify.mysite.azurewebsites.net that you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: While an alias of awverify may work for some registrars, others may require the full alias domain name of awverify.www.customdomainname.com or awverify.customdomainname.com.
trans-unit.target: While an alias of awverify may work for some registrars, others may require the full alias domain name of awverify.www.customdomainname.com or awverify.customdomainname.com.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following will create an CNAME record that Azure can use to verify the A record configuration.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following will create an CNAME record that Azure can use to verify the A record configuration.

trans-unit.source: Alias/Host name/Subdomain
trans-unit.target: Alias/Host name/Subdomain

trans-unit.source: Canonical domain
trans-unit.target: Canonical domain

trans-unit.source: awverify
trans-unit.target: awverify

trans-unit.source: awverify.contoso.azurewebsites.net
trans-unit.target: awverify.contoso.azurewebsites.net

trans-unit.source: It can take some time for the awverify CNAME to propagate through the DNS system.
trans-unit.target: It can take some time for the awverify CNAME to propagate through the DNS system.

trans-unit.source: You cannot set the custom domain name defined by the A record for the website until the awverify CNAME has propagated.
trans-unit.target: You cannot set the custom domain name defined by the A record for the website until the awverify CNAME has propagated.

trans-unit.source: You can use a service such as <html></html>http://www.digwebinterface.com/<html></html> to verify that the CNAME is available.
trans-unit.target: You can use a service such as <html></html>http://www.digwebinterface.com/<html></html> to verify that the CNAME is available.

trans-unit.source: Add the domain name to your website
trans-unit.target: Add the domain name to your website

trans-unit.source: After the awverify CNAME record for domain name has propagated, you can then associate the custom domain defined by the A record with your website.
trans-unit.target: After the awverify CNAME record for domain name has propagated, you can then associate the custom domain defined by the A record with your website.

trans-unit.source: You can add the custom domain name defined by the A record to your website by using either the Azure CLI or by using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can add the custom domain name defined by the A record to your website by using either the Azure CLI or by using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To add a domain name using the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: To add a domain name using the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Install and configure the <link><linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>, and then use the following command:

trans-unit.source: For example, the following will add a custom domain name of contoso.com to the contoso.azurewebsite.net website:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following will add a custom domain name of contoso.com to the contoso.azurewebsite.net website:

trans-unit.source: You can confirm that the custom domain name was added to the website by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: You can confirm that the custom domain name was added to the website by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: The list returned by this command should contain the custom domain name, as well as the default .azurewebsite.net entry.
trans-unit.target: The list returned by this command should contain the custom domain name, as well as the default .azurewebsite.net entry.

trans-unit.source: To add a domain name using the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To add a domain name using the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: In the Websites tab, click the name of your site, select Dashboard, and then select Manage Domains from the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the DOMAIN NAMES text box, type the domain name that you have configured.
trans-unit.target: In the DOMAIN NAMES text box, type the domain name that you have configured.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to accept the domain name.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to accept the domain name.

trans-unit.source: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the domain names section of the Configure page of your website.
trans-unit.target: Once configuration has completed, the custom domain name will be listed in the domain names section of the Configure page of your website.

trans-unit.source: After you have added the custom domain name defined by the A record to your website, you can remove the awverify CNAME record using the tools provided by your registrar.
trans-unit.target: After you have added the custom domain name defined by the A record to your website, you can remove the awverify CNAME record using the tools provided by your registrar.

trans-unit.source: However, if you wish to add another A record in the future, you will have to recreate the awverify record before you can associate the new domain name defined by the new A record with the website.
trans-unit.target: However, if you wish to add another A record in the future, you will have to recreate the awverify record before you can associate the new domain name defined by the new A record with the website.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
